title: A New-years gift for the Whigs: or, A true relation of threescore Presbyters (foot and horse) that surprized two of the kin[gs] guards in their beds at an inn seaven miles from Edenborough, cutting all the flesh off their bon[es] till they were dead, and carried the pieces to their respective friends, and there burned them [in] contempt of God and their king. : Tune of, Then then to the duke let's fill up the glass.
publicationStmtPublisher: Printed for J. Deane bookseller, in Cranborn-street, near Newport-house, in Leicester-fields.,
